content: long tail to sew on to the front panel with a yarn needle i will pull the tail back through the loop under the top of the st to create a curved look like the other side of the nose eyes make 2 make sure to read the notes about how i do my eyes if you would like them to look like mine if you would like them to look like mine instead of slip_stitch and fo inv fo to join and weave in the ends at the end of each round round 1 with black 6 single_crochet in magic_ring slip_stitch to first single_crochet fo 6 round 2 with blue slip_stitch in any single_crochet from round 1 chain 1 increase in next st 4 increase increase in single_crochet you slip_stitch at the start of round slip_stitch to first single_crochet fo 12 round 3 with white slip_stitch in any single_crochet from round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in next st increase single_crochet *5 increase in single_crochet you slip_stitch at the start of round slip_stitch to first single_crochet fo leaving a long tail to sew eyes to the front panel 18 round 4 with buff slip_stitch in any single_crochet from round 3 chain 1 single_crochet into same st 8 single_crochet fo and weave in ends 9 round 4 creates a baggy eye look ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights reserved ears make 2 with buff row 1 4 half_double_crochet in magic_ring do not join pull tail to tighten turn chain 1 4 row 2 half_double_crochet increase in each half_double_crochet turn chain 1 8 row 3 half_double_crochet increase 6 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase turn chain 1 10 row 4-5 10 half_double_crochet turn chain 1 10 fo and leave a long tail to on to the sides of the cover back panel with buff chain 18 row 1 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across turn chain 1 17 row 2-6 half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet across turn chain 1 17 row 15 17 half_double_crochet chain 1 rotate panel 17 we are going to work into 3 sides just like the front panel we will work 1 single_crochet into each row of half_double_crochet except for the corners row 16 14 single_crochet 2 single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet in 15th row corner 1 rotate and work 16 single_crochet along the bottom of the panel single_crochet chain 1 2 single_crochet in 15th row corner 2 14 single_crochet turn chain 1 50 + 2 chain-space assembly optional use sewing pins to hold each piece to the cover nose the top of the nose should be two row above the center hole in the front panel you can slightly curve the top of the nose by sewing the corners of the top of the nose a little lower than the middle to make it stick out sew the edges of the nose to the edges of the center hole ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights
